WorkItem.Description: I tried to read a cell containing the formula : =CZ28+IF(AND($E$78="";DA29<>"");1;IF(AND(DA29<>"";ISNUM(FIND($E$78&$E$79;DC29)));1;0)) Â  but it returns an error : Warning: mb_stripos() [function.mb-stripos]: Empty delimiter in ...\PHPExcel\Calculation\TextData.php line 292

Comments.Message:
Unless you've set formulas to use locale settings, then the argument separator should be a comma (,) not a semi-colon (;)

And ISNUM() is not a valid Excel function.... ISNUMBER() is a valid Excel function

thanks a lot for this answer,

I'm not the writer of the file, and the file cannot be modified can you tell me where you define the comma (,) as an argument separator in your code please.

And sorry for the mistake about ISNUM(), I'm french I tried to translate the function name quickly.

Thanks you were right, I use a french Excel so the argument separator is a semi-colon.
And that's why I did a mistake about ISNUMBER(), I translated quickly the function name.

As I can't modify the Excel file, could you please tell me where I can change the argument separator in your code.

Anymay, you are doing it great with this classes, thanks a lot for your job.

If you're loading the file into PHPExcel, then it already is in English (it's the MS Excel GUI that shows the formula as a locale formula, but internally it's all in English)

Can you identify the values in the cells referenced in the FIND() function of the formula, specifically $E$78, $E$79 and DC29. The only thing I can think could cause this error is empty values in $E$78 and $E$79.

Thanks a lot, my problem is fixed

A cell use in the formula in the cell $E$78 was empty.

Good work
Bugfix to provide correct result in the needle is empty just being committed to github
The one bugfix I've permitted myself while watching the Olympics Opening ceremony
